definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

sentences.english: This is my first time to take the sky-scraping wheel.
sentences.chinese: 這也是我第一次坐摩天輪。

sentences.english: It takes a ferris wheel half an hour to take a turn.
sentences.chinese: 摩天輪需要花半個小時轉一圈。

sentences.english: The ferris wheel can resist 8-magnitude earthquakes and Beaufort scale 12 typhoons.
sentences.chinese: 摩天輪可以抵抗8級大地震及蒲福12級颱風。

sentences.english: Play the 2,125,000 vehicles, roller coaster, Ferris wheel, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 玩了碰碰車，過山車，摩天輪等。

sentences.english: Looking up at the ferris wheel gives me a sense of well-being.
sentences.chinese: 仰望着摩天輪給我一種幸福的感覺。

sentences.english: Take a ride at sunset on the Ferris wheel for a spectacular ocean view.
sentences.chinese: 在夕陽西下時乘在摩天輪爲一個精彩的海景。

sentences.english: Sinujiu has a ferris wheel, but it does not turn.
sentences.chinese: 新義州有一座摩天輪，但卻不轉動。

sentences.english: Overall, how satisfied of your ride on Singapore Flyer Wheel?
sentences.chinese: 總體來說，您對乘坐新加坡巨型摩天輪有多滿意？

sentences.english: The big wheel was built at the Soviet times.
sentences.chinese: 這個摩天輪還是蘇聯時期的時候建的。

sentences.english: Lily: The London Eye or the wheel.
I have already tried the Ferris wheel.
Ferris wheel for each frame house is full of well-being.
sentences.chinese: 摩天輪的每個格子裏都裝滿了幸福。

sentences.english: Today, let's go and play the Ferris wheel in Suzhou Ferris Park.
sentences.chinese: 今天讓我帶大家去蘇州摩天輪樂園遊玩。

sentences.english: When we were on the Ferris wheel, I discovered my fear of heights.
sentences.chinese: 當我們坐摩天輪的時候，我發現我有恐高症。

sentences.english: Do you want to ride the Ferris wheel and merry-go-round?
sentences.chinese: 想要去坐摩天輪和旋轉木馬嗎？

sentences.english: Which is more fun, the roller coaster or the ferri wheel?
sentences.chinese: 哪個更有趣，過山車還是摩天輪？

definition: merry-go-round/carousel/Carousel, South Korean TV soap opera
Wan Chai district of Hong Kong
Victoria Harbor, Hong Kong/abbr. for 維多利亞港|维多利亚港[Wei2 duo1 li4 ya4 Gang3]
to amuse oneself/to have fun/to go sightseeing/to take a stroll
